intro: Polygala australis, commonly known as the Australian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are alternate and usually have a hairy texture, while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Polygala australis is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value.
